page.title: 01THE LANGUAGE OF SUTTON IN A.
page.content: {English}is the language used by 99% of the population of the area. With Sutton being so close to the Derbys. border local words are influenced by both Notts. and Derbys. dialects: for example tea is "mashed" rather than "brewed". There is also a tendency for certain words to be pronounced with more syllables than in standard English: shoo-es for shoes, co-at for coat. Other words are shortened: wok for work and bods for birds. Many local people also distort some words: guz for goes, summat for something, owse for house, missen for myself, om for home and rate for right. A typical local sentence might be,"I guz do-an stre-ut tut shop",or "I go down the street to the shop". WENDY MILLARD SIMON KENWORTHY WAYNE KNIGHT ROBERT RIMMINGTON.
